main event: On August 6, 1952, a radar unit observed several unidentified flying objects in Port Austin, Michigan, detected at high speeds.
interesting points: The radar tracked objects at variable ranges of several thousand yards,The first object was detected at 0719Z and the last at 0755Z, indicating a short duration of observation,The radar image showed objects with erratic and irregular flight patterns,The maximum speed reached by the detected objects was 4505 knots,The only known air traffic during this period was a Trans-Canadian Airlines DC-4 flight that occurred concurrently.
sighted object: unidentified flying objects detected by radar
witness description: Captain Roy V. Anderson, Commanding Officer of the 754th ACAW Squadron
